name: Darul Qasim

dimension_explanations.alignment: Darul Qasim shows medium alignment for Muslim donors by offering zakat-eligible giving options and addressing the urgent need for global Islamic education [3][7]. Its mission is deeply rooted in traditional epistemology and the Arabic language [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through its specialized Islamic curricula, though its program expense ratio is currently 51.9% [1][6]. While it maintains a significant 29.3 months of working capital, there is limited publicly available evidence regarding specific long-term educational outcomes [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Darul Qasim is an Islamic institution of higher learning dedicated to preserving and disseminating traditional knowledge derived from the prophethood of Muhammad.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with only $0.02 spent to raise every $1
Robust liquidity with 29.3 months of working capital available
Clear zakat eligibility and policy for donor contributions
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Glendale Heights, Illinois, Darul Qasim facilitates religious education through programs such as the Shaykh al-Hind Program and Intermediate Islamic Studies [1][4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $3,290,091 and maintains a zakat-eligible status to support its educational mission [1][3].

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="2">$0.02 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions, ensuring that donor acquisition costs remain minimal.
Darul Qasim maintains <cite id="2">29.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer for long-term institutional stability.
The institution has achieved a <cite id="1">3-year revenue CAGR of 23.4%</cite>, indicating increasing community support and scale.

strengths_deep_dive: Darul Qasim's primary strength lies in its institutional stability and fiscal discipline. With <cite id="1">total assets exceeding $10.2 million</cite> and a <cite id="2">100% independent board</cite>, the organization is structured for long-term academic endurance. Its ability to generate <cite id="1">$835,237 in program service revenue</cite> alongside donations suggests a diversifying income model that reduces total reliance on philanthropy. Furthermore, the organization has <cite id="4">documented a clear theory of change</cite> regarding Islamic epistemology, which guides its curriculum and educational outcomes.
rich_narrative.summary: Darul Qasim is an Islamic institution of higher learning based in Glendale Heights, Illinois, dedicated to <cite id="1">preserving and disseminating traditional knowledge</cite> derived from the prophethood of Muhammad. The organization operates as a significant educational hub, offering specialized curricula including the <cite id="4">Shaykh al-Hind Program and Advanced Islamic Studies</cite>. In the 2023 fiscal year, the institution reported <cite id="1">total revenue of $3,290,091</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="1">3-year revenue CAGR of 23.4%</cite>. While the organization maintains a strong focus on academic rigor and spiritual development, its financial structure shows a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 51.9%</cite>, which is notably lower than the <cite id="2">peer program ratio median of 89.6%</cite> for similar global education charities. Despite this, the organization demonstrates exceptional fiscal prudence in its development efforts, maintaining <cite id="2">fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised</cite>. Darul Qasim serves a vital role in the North American Muslim community by providing <cite id="6">structured religious education and epistemology</cite>, supported by a <cite id="3">verified zakat-eligible giving program</cite> that targets specific asnaf including the poor and needy.
